titleStmt.title: TO THE NO LESSE INGENIOVS THEN ZEALOVS fauourer of ingenuity, Sir RICHARD TCHBOVRNE Knight, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE NO LESSE INGENIOVS THEN ZEALOVS fauourer of ingenuity, Sir RICHARD TCHBOVRNE Knight, &c.

monogr.title: The raging Turke, or, Baiazet the Second : A tragedie vvritten by Thomas Goffe, Master of Arts, and student of Christ-Church in Oxford, and acted by the students of the same house
monogr.author: Goffe, Thomas

div.head: TO THE NO LESSE INGENIOVS THEN ZEALOVS fauourer of ingenuity, Sir RICHARD T • CHBOVRNE Knight, &c.
div.p: THis Tragedy, a manuscript, with another of the same Authors, came lately to my hands; He that gaue them birth, because they were his Nugae, or rather recreations to his more serious and diuine studies, out of a nice modesty (as I haue learnt) allowed them • earce priuate fostering. But I, by the consent of his especiall friend▪ in that they shew him rather Omnium scenarum homo to his glory then disparagement: haue published them, and doe tender this to your most safe protection, le • t it w • nder a fatherlesse Orphan, which euery one in that respect will be apt to iniure with calumnious censure. Now if you vouchsafe to receiue and shelter it, you will not onely preserue vnblemish'd the euer-liuing fame of the dead Author, but assure me that you kindly accept this humble acknowledgement of

closer.signed: Your most obliged and ready reall Seruant▪ RICH, MEIGHEN.
